title: (x) 1972 serif book face - Caledonia {Marten Fischer}
content:
I haven’t been able to figure this one out...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [whatfont227275.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122733/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont227275.png) | 53.44 KB |

 [‹ Looking for a Chinese font that complements Gizmo](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122733/http:/typophile.com/node/34751 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) serif face in "Publico" Portuguese newspaper - Publico (custom face) {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122733/http:/typophile.com/node/34684 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Typical

comments.content: Could it be [New Caledonia](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122733/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/new-caledonia/)? Or rather [the original Caledonia](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122733/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caledonia_(typeface)) by William Addison Dwiggins from 1938?

Thank you! That’s it. The capital G is the same. I think it’s the original Caledonia, based on the greater angle on the ascenders (b, h notably). It’s from a 1986 reprint of a 1972 book by Harper and Row.
